feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Custom Reusable elements and Custom Business Objects.
entry.content:
Hello,

I would appreciate your help in sharing your thoughts on the following questions.

1. I've created a Custom Reusable Element, and I'm wondering if it's possible to enable it from the Manage Master Data app.

When I try to call it from Custom Fields, using the Type Code List based on CDs View, the custom reusable element doesn't appear.
Is this possible?

2.I have also created Custom Business Objects, when I try to call it from Custom Fields, using the Type Code List based on CDs View, the Custom Business Objects doesn't appear.

 

Note:
I have reviewed documentation or blogs but I have not been able to find the configuration I need.

I would appreciate your feedback.

Thank you very much.

entry.title: CBO Transported to TEST but Not Available in Business Catalog – SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are working with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and using Key User Extensibility to create Custom Business Objects (CBOs).

The CBO is:

  • Created and published in DEV

  • Assigned to a business catalog in DEV

  • Successfully transported to the TEST system

However, in the TEST environment, the CBO is visible in the Custom Business Objects app, but cannot be found or assigned in any business catalog, even though the same catalog exists and was used in DEV.

My questions:

  • Is this behavior expected in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

  • Are business catalog assignments for CBOs supposed to be re-done manually in each system?

  • Is there a specific sequence of steps that must be followed after transport to make the CBO available for catalog assignment?

Any clarification or best practices would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: How to retrieve open AR items including partial payments in Custom CDS View (same as F0711)?
entry.content:
Title:
How to retrieve open AR items including partial payments in Custom CDS View (same as F0711)?
Body:
Objective:
I need to create a custom CDS view that retrieves the same open AR line items as the standard Fiori app F0711 (Manage Customer Line Items) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
Current Situation:
I'm using I_JournalEntryOperationalView as the primary data source with the following WHERE clause:


ClearingDate = '00000000'
AND IsOpenItemManaged = 'X'
AND (AccountingDocumentType = 'RV'
OR AccountingDocumentType = 'DR')
```

**Problem:**
This condition works for most cases, but **it excludes items with partial payments**. When a partial payment is posted, the `ClearingDate` field gets populated (e.g., '20230713'), even though the item still has an outstanding balance.

**Example:**
- Journal Entry: 1800000000
- Line Item: 000001
- `ClearingDate`: '20230713' (not '00000000')
- `IsOpenItemManaged`: 'X'
- Status in F0711: **Open (Clearing Status = 2)**
- Status in my CDS View: **Excluded** (due to ClearingDate filter)

**Question:**
Which field(s) should I use to correctly identify open items including partially cleared items, matching the logic of F0711?

I've tried:
- `ClearingJournalEntry` (empty check)
- `ClearingAccountingDocument` (empty check)
- `ReceivableFinancingStatus` (not populated in our system)

**Additional Info:**
- System: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
- Data Source: `I_JournalEntryOperationalView`
- Fiori App: F0711 - Manage Customer Line Items

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks and Regards,

Praveen

entry.title: Payment Block Not Transferred to AR Line Item from Billing Document in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are facing an issue with payment block transfer in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Issue Description:

When we create a billing document with a payment term that has a payment block setting, the payment block is not transferred to the AR line item of the automatically posted accounting document.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Created a payment term with payment block reason (e.g., `A` - All items)
2. Created a sales order using this payment term
3. Created a billing document (VF01) referring to the sales order
4. Checked the accounting document posted automatically from the billing document
5. Result: Payment block is missing in the AR line item (Customer line)

Expected Behavior:

The payment block should be transferred from the payment term to the AR line item, so that the invoice is excluded from automatic payment runs.

On-Premise Solution:

In S/4HANA On-Premise, SAP Note 132701 instructs us to implement a User Exit to transfer the payment block from billing document to accounting document.

Question:

How can we achieve this in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

- Is there a standard configuration to enable this?
- Should we use a specific Business Add-In (BAdI)?
- Is there a custom logic app or extension required?
- Are there any SAP Notes or best practices for this scenario in Public Cloud?

Environment:

- SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (latest release)
- Activated scope items: 1G1 (Sell from Stock), BDG (Accounts Receivable)

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

entry.content:
Hi Experts,

How do I create an XML structure of header and items in RAP Core SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
I've tried, but only the header created on the form. So the form just showed the header data.

Thank you.

#SAPS/4HANACloudPublicEdition
#RAP

entry.title: Storing of documents in database table
entry.content:
In S/4 HANA Public Cloud, I'm developing a custom fiori app that will create a contract upon approval. This app also allows uploading of attachments like pdf files. While transaction is waiting for approval, all information are stored in a custom database table. 

I know there is a DMS in BTP which allow uploading of file without any business object but client is on a budget and cannot afford.

I understand that API_ATTACHMENT_SRV only allow uploading of file when linked to a business object. But in my case, the business object is not yet created.

I'm thinking if I just convert the file into binary rawstring and store it in a custom database in the meantime. Then use the attachment api to upload the file and link it to the created business object and deleting it from the db table.

is it advisable to do this method?

what are the possible implications of doing this method?

entry.title: Settlement Error in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Cost Element Not Assigned to Source Structure
entry.content:
Settlement Error in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Cost Element Not Assigned to Source Structure

**Body:**

Hello SAP Community,

I'm encountering an error when settling an investment project (F4568) in **SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition**.

**Error Message:**
```
No source assignment found for cost element 61003000

Diagnosis:
The sender bears the YS source structure and was debited with costs from the 61003000 cost element. This cost element is not assigned to any source assignment in the A000 controlling area of the YS source structure.

Procedure:
Maintain the YS source structure.
```

**Environment:**
- SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
- Controlling Area: A000
- Cost Element: 61003000 (Primary cost element, Category 1 - Travel Expense Hotel)
- Project Type: Investment Project (AUC)
- Transaction: Settlement (F4568)

**What I've Found:**
1. In "Analysis of Value Category Assignments" app, cost element 61003000 appears in the "Not assigned" list
2. I tried to assign it to a Value Category but cannot edit from this screen
3. Allocation Structure YT (PS Project Settlement) uses Cost Element Group "100_CE" which doesn't exist in the system

**My Question:**
Could someone provide a **step-by-step solution** with specific **app names and IDs** to resolve this error in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

Please note: I need solutions specific to **Public Cloud only** - on-premise transaction codes (like OKEU, KAH2) are not applicable.

Thank you in advance for your help!

entry.title: SAP Analytical Reports G\L Accounts Goods Receipt/Manufacturing Order Seperate Rows
entry.content:
Hi Good Day SAP Community I have a Problem

I am building an Analytical Report in S/4HANA based on a CDS data source.

My report shows costs by G/L / cost structure, which is working correctly.
However, I also need to display Production in Kilos and Total Quantity as separate rows,

Important:

These production quantities are not related to G/L Accounts and should not be aligned or broken down by them. They should appear as standalone totals (e.g. at the bottom of the report), as shown in the attached image.

 

 



This describes the exact problem I am trying to solve. Please see the attached image for reference.

This is the data from the extracted report.

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud - How to retrieve currency code list via API?
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm working on S/4HANA Public Cloud integration and need to retrieve a list of currency codes (like JPY, USD, EUR, etc.) via API.

I found SAP_COM_0114 (Currency Master Data Replication), but it seems to be for outbound replication (push data to external systems), not for reading/getting currency data.

Could you please advise:
1. Which API (OData or SOAP) can I use to GET/READ currency codes?
2. Which Communication Scenario should I use?

Environment: S/4HANA Public Cloud

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: JSON Payload Download Implementation in RAP Application
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

I am currently working on a custom RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model) Application in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. In this application, we use an API to send data to an external portal.

Now there is a new requirement when the user clicks a button, the JSON payload that is used in the ABAP program for sending data via the API should be downloaded in JSON format.

For this purpose, I have already created a custom action in the Behavior Definition, and the button is visible in the Application. My question is how to implement the download functionality so that the same JSON payload used for the API call can be downloaded by the user in JSON format and Also, please explain how to implement the JSON download functionality in the RAP application with step by step guidance.

Thank you,

entry.title: Timesheet completeness validation
entry.content:
Hi all,

We are configuring the professional services solution of S/4Hana Public Cloud for Customer Projects and Time recording. 

We are looking for a solution to check whether all consultants have completed their timesheets (minimal of hours written per week+leave = workschedule) before Project Management can effectively start the Billing Preparation.

As far as we can tell there is no standard solution for this available.

Are there any Professional Services companies here who implemented a solution for this? We see possibilities for building custom logic with BadI or a building a CDS view that shows the total amount of hours written for each employee compared to their work schedule. The latter seems like the most viable option that provides immediate insight into which hours are missing.

Are there any other alternatives out there that we could look into?

Regards, Vasco

entry.title: Issue Consuming Custom Business Object (CBO) in RAP CDS View – “Not Permitted” Error
entry.content:
<P>Hi,

I have created a Custom Business Object (CBO) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud using key user extensibility. I want to consume this CBO in a RAP model to generate an application in Eclipse, using the CBO as the primary business object. However, when I try to use the CBO as a data source in a RAP CDS view, it shows as “Not Permitted.” Please suggest an appropriate approach to resolve this issue.

warm regards

Shiva</p>

entry.title: Settlement Rule Configuration Issue for Overhead Project (1NT Test Script) - Receiver Category PSG N
entry.content:
Title: Settlement Rule Configuration Issue for Overhead Project (1NT Test Script) - Receiver Category PSG Not Allowed

Hello SAP Community,

I am currently working through the 1NT test script for SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition and encountered an issue with settlement rule configuration for an overhead project.

**Situation:**
- Following the 1NT test script section "1.1 Register Project"
- Project created successfully with Project Profile: "Overhead Project (間接費プロジェクト)"
- Settlement Profile assigned: YPSOVH (PS Settlement Overhead Project)

**Issue:**
When attempting to update the settlement rule with Receiver Category "PSG" (Profitability Segment) as instructed in the test script, I receive the following error:

> "Receiver categ. PSG is not allowed by settlement prof. YPSOVH for this"

**Configuration Check (Activity 105768):**
- In settlement profile YPSOVH, the "Profit. Segment" receiver category is set to "Settlement Not Allowed" and appears grayed out (cannot be changed)
- Other receiver categories like G/L Account, Cost Center, and WBS Element are set to "Settlement Optional"

**Questions:**
1. Is PSG (Profitability Segment) typically not allowed as a receiver for overhead projects?
2. Should the test script be using a different receiver category for overhead projects?
3. If PSG should be allowed, what configuration steps am I missing to enable it?
4. How should I proceed with the 1NT test script in this situation?

**Test Script Reference:**
The test script states:
> "Update settlement rule for project (applicable only for projects with revenue)
> Category: PSG"

This makes me wonder if the test script example using "overhead project" is appropriate for PSG settlement, or if there's a configuration prerequisite I'm missing.

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

**Environment:** SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition
**Configuration Activity:** 105768
**Settlement Profile:** YPSOVH

entry.title: BADI MMIM_ITEM_PROVIDE_DATA doesn't get triggered during SES creation
entry.content:
Dear all,

After the SES creation via Manage Service Entry Sheets - Lean Services is approved, Material Document will be created.

The form output is expected to be displayed in Post Goods Movement App (Output tab) using the generated Material Document. I'm using data source FDP_GR4PO_COL_SLIP_SRV for the Form output.

I have created some additional custom fields for data source FDP_GR4PO_COL_SLIP_SRV (they are visible in the data source extension), used custom logic MMIM_ITEM_PROVIDE_DATA to populate their values. However, after SES creation and approval and material document is created, the custom fields values are not populated, its displaying blank value in form data XML. Using custom logic trace, the BADI seems not triggered in this scenario.

Can anyone tell me which BADI else can be used to add the custom fields into this data source for this scenario?

Note: I have checked the data source extension, the available pre-delivered fields are not sufficient, thus I'm creating the new custom fields.
